reg:regulation.reg:title: Farmers' Food Donation Tax Credit Regulation

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Income Tax Act;
qualifying school has the same meaning as in section 4.36 of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 20.1 of the Act, agricultural products means food or drink that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is intended for human consumption, and

may be lawfully sold, distributed or offered for sale at a place other than the premises at which the eligible taxpayer or, if the eligible taxpayer is an individual, the spouse or common-law partner of the individual carries on the business of farming in British Columbia,

bcl:section.bcl:text: but does not include food or drink that is more than minimally processed.
For the purposes of the definition of "eligible donee" in section 20.1 of the Act, a registered charity must meet at least one of the following criteria:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the registered charity distributes food in British Columbia for the relief of poverty;
the registered charity is engaged in providing meals or snacks to students in a qualifying school.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Income Tax Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 215, section 20.1]
